page.title: 07TWO VILLAGE CHURCHES (C.E.)
page.content: One vicar{(Yate Team Ministry)}looks after both{Westerleigh}(st.James the Great)and{Wapley}(St.Peter)churches. The first vicar was appointed in 1269. An original farm{monastery}was destroyed by Henry V111 and the present churches date from the 15th and 16th centuries. { Morning services,}mostly Holy Communion,are held at Westerleigh. Mixed{evening services}are held at Wapley.The vicar finds some difficulty rushing between the churches especially for Saturday{weddings. Numbers of{churchgoers}from the villages,rural areas and Yate,have risen at Westerleigh over the last few years.At Wapley,numbers tend to increase in the summer.Cold,dark winter evenings probably deter peole from going out along the small country lanes to the churches.
